tags.name: ProtocolService
tags.description: A service providing a set of stateless APIs for constructing and broadcasting Network-specific transactions.

post.description: Broadcasts a transaction to a node in the Network.

parameters.name: networkName
parameters.description:
The resource name of the Network.
Format: networks/{network_id}

transaction.description:
The transaction to broadcast. For the broadcast to complete successfully,
the required_signatures' signature values must be populated (i.e. the transaction must be signed).

schema.description:
The request message for BroadcastTransaction. For the broadcast to complete successfully,
the required_signatures' signature values must be populated (i.e. the transaction must be signed).

post.description: Constructs an unsigned transaction. The payloads in the required_signatures of the returned Transaction must be signed before the Transaction is broadcast.

parameters.name: networkName
parameters.description:
The resource name of the Network.
Format: networks/{network_id}

input.description: The input indicating the unsigned transaction to construct.

post.description: Constructs an unsigned transfer transaction. A transfer transaction is a transaction that moves an Asset from one Address to another. The payloads in the required_signatures of the returned Transaction must be signed before the Transaction is broadcast.

parameters.name: networkName
parameters.description:
The resource name of the Network on which the transfer is happening.
Format: networks/{network_id}

asset.description:
The resource name of the Asset being transferred.
Format: networks/{network_id}/assets/{asset_id}.

sender.description: The address of the sender, e.g. as a 0x-prefixed hex string.

recipient.description: The address of the recipient, e.g. as a 0x-prefixed hex string.

amount.description:
The amount of the asset to transfer, denominated in atomic units of the asset (e.g. Wei),
either as a "0x"-prefixed hex string or a base-10 number.

nonce.description:
The nonce of the from address to be used in transaction construction.
This is required only for Account-based networks (e.g. EVM).

fee.description: The fee to be paid for the transfer. If not provided, the API will default to a network-based fee estimate.

maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: The EIP-1559 maximum priority fee per gas either as a "0x"-prefixed hex string or a base-10 number.

maxFeePerGas.description: The EIP-1559 maximum fee per gas either as a "0x"-prefixed hex string or a base-10 number.

v1DynamicFeeInput.description: A message representing fee information on EIP-1559 supported networks.

r.description: The 32-byte R value of the signature in big-endian order.

s.description: The 32-byte S value of the signature in big-endian order.

v.description: The V value of the signature, if it exists.

v1ECDSASignature.description: A digital signature produced by the elliptic curve digital signature algorithm (ECDSA).

chainId.description: The chain ID of the transaction either as a "0x"-prefixed hex string or a base-10 number.

nonce.description: The nonce of the transaction. This value may be ignored depending on the API.

maxPriorityFeePerGas.description: The EIP-1559 maximum priority fee per gas either as a "0x"-prefixed hex string or a base-10 number.

maxFeePerGas.description: The EIP-1559 maximum fee per gas either as a "0x"-prefixed hex string or a base-10 number.

gas.description: The maximum amount of gas to use on the transaction.

fromAddress.description:
The checksummed address from which the transaction will originate, as a "0x"-prefixed hex string.
Note: This is NOT a WaaS Address resource of the form
networks/{networkID}/addresses/{addressID}.

toAddress.description:
The checksummed address to which the transaction is addressed, as a "0x"-prefixed hex string.
Note: This is NOT a WaaS Address resource of the form
networks/{networkID}/addresses/{addressID}.

value.description: The native value of the transaction as a "0x"-prefixed hex string or a base-10 number.

v1EIP1559TransactionInput.description: A message representing an EIP-1559 transaction input.

sender.description: The sender address as a hexadecimal string, prefixed with 0x.

transactionRlp.description:
The RLP-encoded transaction as a byte array.
See https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/master/rlp/encode.go for an implementation.

v1RLPTransaction.description:
A message representing a transaction encoded using Recursive-Length Prefix (RLP)
Serialization. See https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/data-structures-and-encoding/rlp/
for more details.

payload.description:
The payload to be signed. The TransactionInput must be transformed into
this payload. For EVM chains, this would be the hash of the type-prefixed
RLP encoding of the transaction defined in EIP-2718. This is also the
value that should be used in the MPCKeyService's CreateSignature API.

signature.description:
The signature representing the signed payload. This must be set in order
for a Transaction to be broadcast.

v1RequiredSignature.description: A message representing a payload to be signed and its result.

v1Signature.description: A digital signature produced by a signing algorithm.

input.description: A user-specified transaction in one of the supported input types.

requiredSignatures.description:
The set of signatures required to broadcast this Transaction.
For EVM networks, there will be only one signature.

rawSignedTransaction.description:
The signed transaction to be broadcast. This value can be directly broadcast on-chain.
The Signatures in required_signatures need to be transformed into this value.
For EVM chains, this is just the R, S, and V values of the signature concatenated.

hash.description: The hash of the signed transaction.

v1Transaction.description:
A message that wraps protocol-specific transactions, and provides additional
payloads that enable the transaction to be signed and broadcast.

ethereumFee.description: An EIP-1559 fee on EVM networks.

v1TransactionFee.description: A message representing the fee to be paid for a transaction.

v1TransactionInput.description: A message that contains each of the different transaction types we support.
